item.title: The Modern Renaissance Man
item.description: I have been dealing with the macro-questions of life and how I’d like to live mine “well”. Some of the answers are found in the books, but some remain un-answered because of their specificity. Today, I met Shubhouy, someone who I’d say has “seen things”, being a triple masters and worked numerous roles. In a conversation I was delighted to have, I found some answers and direction to life I was looking for.

item.title: The Theory of Everything - Stephen Hawking
item.description: I have always been inspired by the great Stephen Hawking, and have always been in awe of the example this guy set - there is no real hurdle if one is committed enough! The Theory of Everything had always been in my “to-read” list, but had been waiting in the queue for quite a while. When I visited home this time, picked this up from my shelf along with a couple of other books.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
